perturbation.original_text: The provisions of Sections 5.1(c) and 5.1(d) and this Section 5.8 shall run with the Joint IP, and each party shall ensure that any assignee of its interest in the Joint IP expressly assumes in writing such provisions.
perturbation.changed_text: The provisions of Sections 5.1(c) and 5.1(d) and this Section 5.8 may run with the Joint IP, and each party shall attempt to ensure that any assignee of its interest in the Joint IP assumes such provisions.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall ensure' to 'shall attempt to ensure' weakens the obligation on the parties to guarantee that assignees comply with the IP provisions. 'May run' introduces doubt about whether the provisions apply to assignees at all. This contradicts basic contract law principles about ensuring the enforcement of contract terms against assignees, making the obligation ambiguous.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability of Contract Terms against Assignees

perturbation.original_text: Conformis shall ensure that all its employees, consultants, Agents or other Third Parties who perform any portion of Conformis' R&D Program obligations under this Agreement have entered into written agreements with Conformis whereby such employee, consultant, Agent or other Third Party assigns to Conformis all ownership rights in any Inventions made or developed by such employee, consultant, Agent or Third Party in the course of such R&D Program work under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Conformis shall endeavor to ensure that its employees, consultants, Agents or other Third Parties who perform any portion of Conformis' R&D Program obligations under this Agreement have agreements with Conformis regarding the assignment of ownership rights in any Inventions.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall ensure that all...have entered into written agreements' to 'shall endeavor to ensure that its employees...have agreements' weakens the obligation to require written agreements with specific assignment clauses. The vague 'agreements regarding the assignment' doesn't guarantee actual assignment of IP, creating ambiguity and weakening Conformis' control over IP rights developed during the R&D program. This can conflict with intellectual property law principles related to assignment and ownership of inventions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law - Assignment of Inventions

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Parties shall record in written or electronic form all material information with respect to the performance of its obligations relating to the R&D Program in accordance with standard industry practices.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Parties should record information with respect to the performance of its obligations relating to the R&D Program, as they deem reasonably necessary.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall record' to 'should record' and removing the requirement to adhere to 'standard industry practices' introduces ambiguity. Replacing 'all material information' with 'as they deem reasonably necessary' makes the record-keeping obligation discretionary and undermines the requirement for comprehensive documentation. This contradicts generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and industry-specific regulations that mandate specific record-keeping practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and Industry-Specific Record-Keeping Regulations
perturbation.location: Article IX - Record-Keeping and Audits, Section 9.1
